availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Bell Patrick (Breathitt Co & Cir Ct Clerk)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, clerk and Confederate soldier. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Married Prudence Patrick. Father of Armina C. Patrick, Samuel H. Patrick, James C. Patrick, Amelia Belle Patrick, John M. E. Patrick, and George C. Patrick. Clerk of the Breathitt County Court and the Breathitt Circuit Court in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Breathitt County in 1850. Owned two enslaved people in Breathitt County in 1860. Enlisted in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C. S. A.) on May 10, 1863. Deserted from the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C. S. A.) in Virginia in 1864.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District No. 1; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District No. 1; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District No. 1, p. 119; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, District No. 1, p. 3; Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0111; Find A Grave, "Alexander Bell Patrick (1818 - 1881)," Memorial #38781868, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=38781868 (accessed September 18, 2017).
